column5: I got my first gas fitters license  on thursday , two monthes of school paid off, now im going for four more monthes to get my second license so i will be able to work alone. Any ideas of where i should start looking for a job, or does anybody know anyone who is hiring in the heating and cooling or natural gas trade?
Go west young man.....   Where about are you located? in my trade I deal with mechanical contractors daily....  G
I live in orr lake. Between barrie and midland just in case you dont know where that is Gerrit
Sorry.. I am in the GTA.. but I will keep an ear out for someone looking to take on another apprentice.  G
Thanks Gerrit that would be awesome!

Direct Energy is usually looking for good tradesmen--I would get on the phone to construction contractors in the refrigeration/sheet metal installation companies.  Barrie is a bigger centre and will probably pay better than Midland---Like I mentioned in your west question--gas fitter will lead to other trades.  On long shot trades--every once in a while you can get into some industrial manufacturers--little harder as most are unionized and apprenticeships usually go internal with seniority.  Bushart

livinisfishin,  Please PM me... One of my sub-trades would be interested in talking with you... His name is Tony and is one hell of a great guy. I just got off the phone with him and brought you up in our conversation.  Company name is Tri-Star Mechanical  I will set you up with his contact info and he has asked you to call him.  Gerritt.
Awesome work G! Let me know if your lookin for work... I could use an industrious guy like you! Opps... don't let Marcus read this! LOL HH
LOL!.... now lets discuss the commission structure  G
More for me and less for you! HH
But yah GOTTA come to work on time G !
Gotta love a site like this where someone can post something like this and get a solid lead within hours!!!
You've got that right Cliff. Some seem to hate the non-fishing posts... but it's posts like this that tie it all together...
Good on ya Gerritt  Best of luck livinisfishin, hope all works out.
Very good   . Way to go Gerritt!!
I guess you decided not to move West?  Good luck!
Thank you very much Gerritt! KyleM i havent decided against it , its just im just starting my second course.

LOL... I know someone helped me with trying to get a new job last year after being out of the work force for 10 months due to injury and surgery..... it was my turn to pay it forward..  It was my pleasure to try and help out....  Now it is all up to Jason.   G
